dt: {bc}to put a charge or load into a weapon again

dt.t: … most competitive shooters {wi}reload{/wi} their own ammunition.
This firearm will continuously load, fire, eject, {wi}reload{/wi}, and fire again …

dt: {bc}to load or be loaded into a computer's memory or storage again

dt.t: recorded the time the computer's operating system took to {wi}reload{/wi}
The files are stored locally, so that whenever you access a Web site that you have accessed previously, the browser doesn't have to {wi}reload{/wi} the entire page; it simply reads it from the cache.

dt: {bc}to put a renewed supply of funds or resources into an account

dt.t: However, the new tickets can not be {wi}reloaded{/wi} with credit like a standard smartcard.

shortdef: to put a charge or load into a weapon again
to load or be loaded into a computer's memory or storage again
